intro: Garnotia bidentata, commonly known as the two-toothed garnet, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or streamside habitats. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Garnotia bidentata is often found in shaded environments and is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
